  25    DMSWARM_PIC = 1

  28class SwarmPICLayout(Enum):
  29    """
  30    Particle population fill type:
  31
  32    SwarmPICLayout.REGULAR     defines points on a regular ijk mesh. Supported by simplex cell types only.
  33    SwarmPICLayout.GAUSS       defines points using an npoint Gauss-Legendre tensor product quadrature rule.
  34    SwarmPICLayout.SUBDIVISION defines points on the centroid of a sub-divided reference cell.
  35    """
  36
  37    REGULAR = 0
  38    GAUSS = 1
  39    SUBDIVISION = 2
  40
  41
  42# Note - much of the setup is necessarily the same as the MeshVariable
  43# and the duplication should be removed.
  44
  45
  46class SwarmVariable(Stateful, uw_object):
  47    """
  48    The SwarmVariable class generates a variable supported by a point cloud or 'swarm' and the
  49    underlying meshVariable representation that makes it possible to construct expressions that
  50    depend on the values of the swarmVariable.
  51
  52    To set / read nodal values, use the numpy interface via the 'data' property.
  53
  54    Parameters
  55    ----------
  56    varname :
  57        A textual name for this variable.
  58    swarm :
  59        The supporting underworld swarm.
  60    size :
  61        The shape of a Matrix variable type.
  62    vtype :
  63        Semi-Optional. The underworld variable type for this variable.
  64    proxy_degree :
  65        The polynomial degree for this variable.
  66     proxy_continuous :
  67        The polynomial degree for this variable.
  68    varsymbol:
  69        A symbolic form for printing etc (sympy / latex)
  70    rebuild_on_cycle:
  71        For cyclic swarm variables — True is the best choice for continuous fields
  72
  73    """
  74
  75    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
  76    def __init__(
  77        self,
  78        name,
  79        swarm,
  80        size=None,  # only needed if MATRIX type
  81        vtype=None,
  82        dtype=float,
  83        proxy_degree=1,
  84        proxy_continuous=True,
  85        _register=True,
  86        _proxy=True,
  87        _nn_proxy=False,
  88        varsymbol=None,
  89        rebuild_on_cycle=True,
  90    ):
  91        if name in swarm.vars.keys():
  92            raise ValueError(
  93                "Variable with name {} already exists on swarm.".format(name)
  94            )
  95
  96        import re
  97        import sympy
  98        import math
  99
 100        if varsymbol is None:
 101            varsymbol = name
 102
 103        self.name = name
 104        self.clean_name = re.sub(r"[^a-zA-Z0-9_]", "", name)
 105        self.symbol = varsymbol
 106
 107        self.swarm = swarm
 108        self.shape = size
 109
 110        mesh = swarm.mesh
 111
 112        if vtype == None:
 113            if isinstance(size, int) and size == 1:
 114                vtype = uw.VarType.SCALAR
 115            elif isinstance(size, int) and size == mesh.dim:
 116                vtype = uw.VarType.VECTOR
 117            elif isinstance(size, tuple):
 118                if size[0] == mesh.dim and size[1] == mesh.dim:
 119                    vtype = uw.VarType.TENSOR
 120                else:
 121                    vtype = uw.VarType.MATRIX
 122            else:
 123                raise ValueError(
 124                    "Unable to infer variable type from `num_components`. Please explicitly set the `vtype` parameter."
 125                )
 126
 127        self.vtype = vtype
 128
 129        if not isinstance(vtype, uw.VarType):
 130            raise ValueError(
 131                "'vtype' must be an instance of 'Variable_Type', for example `underworld.VarType.SCALAR`."
 132            )
 133
 134        if vtype == uw.VarType.SCALAR:
 135            self.num_components = 1
 136            self.shape = (1, 1)
 137            self.cpt_map = 0
 138        elif vtype == uw.VarType.VECTOR:
 139            self.num_components = mesh.dim
 140            self.shape = (1, mesh.dim)
 141            self.cpt_map = tuple(range(0, mesh.dim))
 142        elif vtype == uw.VarType.TENSOR:
 143            self.num_components = mesh.dim * mesh.dim
 144            self.shape = (mesh.dim, mesh.dim)
 145        elif vtype == uw.VarType.SYM_TENSOR:
 146            self.num_components = math.comb(mesh.dim + 1, 2)
 147            self.shape = (mesh.dim, mesh.dim)
 148        elif vtype == uw.VarType.MATRIX:
 149            self.num_components = self.shape[0] * self.shape[1]
 150
 151        self._data_container = np.empty(self.shape, dtype=object)
 152
 153        if (dtype == float) or (dtype == "float") or (dtype == np.float64):
 154            self.dtype = float
 155            petsc_type = PETSc.ScalarType
 156        elif (
 157            (dtype == int)
 158            or (dtype == "int")
 159            or (dtype == np.int32)
 160            or (dtype == np.int64)
 161        ):
 162            self.dtype = int
 163            petsc_type = PETSc.IntType
 164        else:
 165            raise TypeError(
 166                f"Provided dtype={dtype} is not supported. Supported types are 'int' and 'float'."
 167            )
 168
 169        if _register:
 170            self.swarm.dm.registerField(
 171                self.clean_name, self.num_components, dtype=petsc_type
 172            )
 173
 174        self._data = None
 175        # add to swarms dict
 176
 177        self.swarm._vars[self.clean_name] = self
 178        self._is_accessed = False
 179
 180        # proxy variable
 181        self._proxy = _proxy
 182        self._vtype = vtype
 183        self._proxy_degree = proxy_degree
 184        self._proxy_continuous = proxy_continuous
 185        self._nn_proxy = _nn_proxy
 186        self._create_proxy_variable()
 187
 188        # recycle swarm
 189        self._rebuild_on_cycle = rebuild_on_cycle
 190        self._register = _register
 191
 192        from collections import namedtuple
 193
 194        SwarmVariable_ij = namedtuple("SwarmVariable_ij", ["data", "sym"])
 195
 196        if self._proxy:
 197            for i in range(0, self.shape[0]):
 198                for j in range(0, self.shape[1]):
 199                    self._data_container[i, j] = SwarmVariable_ij(
 200                        data=f"SwarmVariable[...].data is only available within mesh.access() context",
 201                        sym=self.sym[i, j],
 202                    )
 203
 204        super().__init__()
 205
 206        return
 207
 208    def __getitem__(self, indices):
 209        if not isinstance(indices, tuple):
 210            if isinstance(indices, int) and self.shape[0] == 1:
 211                i = 0
 212                j = indices
 213            else:
 214                raise IndexError(
 215                    "SwarmVariable[i,j] access requires one or two indices "
 216                )
 217        else:
 218            i, j = indices
 219
 220        return self._data_container[i, j]
 221
 222    ## Should be a single master copy
 223    def _data_layout(self, i, j=None):
 224        # mapping
 225
 226        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.SCALAR:
 227            return 0
 228        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.VECTOR:
 229            if j is None:
 230                return i
 231            elif i == 0:
 232                return j
 233            else:
 234                raise IndexError(
 235                    f"Vectors have shape {self.mesh.dim} or {(1, self.mesh.dim)} "
 236                )
 237        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.TENSOR:
 238            if self.swarm.mesh.dim == 2:
 239                return ((0, 1), (2, 3))[i][j]
 240            else:
 241                return ((0, 1, 2), (3, 4, 5), (6, 7, 8))[i][j]
 242
 243        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.SYM_TENSOR:
 244            if self.swarm.mesh.dim == 2:
 245                return ((0, 2), (2, 1))[i][j]
 246            else:
 247                return ((0, 3, 4), (3, 1, 5), (4, 5, 2))[i][j]
 248
 249        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.MATRIX:
 250            return i + j * self.shape[0]
 251
 252    def _create_proxy_variable(self):
 253        # release if defined
 254        self._meshVar = None
 255
 256        if self._proxy:
 257            self._meshVar = uw.discretisation.MeshVariable(
 258                "proxy_" + self.clean_name,
 259                self.swarm._mesh,
 260                self.shape,
 261                self._vtype,
 262                degree=self._proxy_degree,
 263                continuous=self._proxy_continuous,
 264                varsymbol=r"\left<" + self.symbol + r"\right>",
 265            )
 266
 267    def _update(self):
 268        """
 269        This method updates the proxy mesh variable for the current
 270        swarm & particle variable state.
 271        """
 272
 273        # if not proxied, nothing to do. return.
 274        if not self._meshVar:
 275            return
 276
 277        else:
 278            self._rbf_to_meshVar(self._meshVar)
 279
 280        return
 281
 282    # Maybe rbf_interpolate for this one and meshVar is a special case
 283    def _rbf_to_meshVar(self, meshVar, nnn=None, verbose=False):
 284        """
 285        Here is how it works: for each particle, create a distance-weighted average on the node data
 286
 287        Todo: caching the k-d trees etc for the proxy-mesh-variable nodal points
 288        Todo: some form of global fall-back for when there are no particles on a processor
 289        """
 290
 291        # Mapping to the coordinates of the variable from the
 292        # particle coords
 293
 294        if nnn is None:
 295            nnn = self.swarm.mesh.dim + 1
 296
 297        if meshVar.mesh != self.swarm.mesh:
 298            raise RuntimeError("Cannot map a swarm to a different mesh")
 299
 300        new_coords = meshVar.coords
 301
 302        Values = self.rbf_interpolate(new_coords, verbose=verbose, nnn=nnn)
 303
 304        with meshVar.mesh.access(meshVar):
 305            meshVar.data[...] = Values[...]
 306
 307        return
 308
 309    def _rbf_reduce_to_meshVar(self, meshVar, verbose=False):
 310        """
 311        This method updates a mesh variable for the current
 312        swarm & particle variable state by reducing the swarm to
 313        the nearest point for each particle
 314
 315        Here is how it works:
 316
 317            1) for each particle, create a distance-weighted average on the node data
 318            2) check to see which nodes have zero weight / zero contribution and replace with nearest particle value
 319
 320        Todo: caching the k-d trees etc for the proxy-mesh-variable nodal points
 321        Todo: some form of global fall-back for when there are no particles on a processor
 322
 323        """
 324
 325        # if not proxied, nothing to do. return.
 326        if not self._meshVar:
 327            return
 328
 329        # 1 - Average particles to nodes with distance weighted average
 330
 331        kd = uw.kdtree.KDTree(meshVar.coords)
 332        kd.build_index()
 333
 334        with self.swarm.access():
 335            n, d, b = kd.find_closest_point(self.swarm.data)
 336
 337            node_values = np.zeros((meshVar.coords.shape[0], self.num_components))
 338            w = np.zeros(meshVar.coords.shape[0])
 339
 340            if not self._nn_proxy:
 341                for i in range(self.data.shape[0]):
 342                    if b[i]:
 343                        node_values[n[i], :] += self.data[i, :] / (1.0e-24 + d[i])
 344                        w[n[i]] += 1.0 / (1.0e-24 + d[i])
 345
 346                node_values[np.where(w > 0.0)[0], :] /= w[np.where(w > 0.0)[0]].reshape(
 347                    -1, 1
 348                )
 349
 350        # 2 - set NN vals on mesh var where w == 0.0
 351
 352        p_nnmap = self.swarm._get_map(self)
 353
 354        with self.swarm.mesh.access(meshVar), self.swarm.access():
 355            meshVar.data[...] = node_values[...]
 356            meshVar.data[np.where(w == 0.0), :] = self.data[
 357                p_nnmap[np.where(w == 0.0)], :
 358            ]
 359
 360        return
 361
 362    def rbf_interpolate(self, new_coords, verbose=False, nnn=None):
 363        # An inverse-distance mapping is quite robust here ... as long
 364        # as long we take care of the case where some nodes coincide (likely if used mesh2mesh)
 365        # We try to eliminate contributions from recently remeshed particles
 366
 367        import numpy as np
 368
 369        with self.swarm.access():
 370            data_size = self.data.shape
 371
 372        # What to do if there are no particles
 373        if data_size[0] <= 1:
 374            return np.zeros((new_coords.shape[0], data_size[1]))
 375
 376        if nnn is None:
 377            nnn = self.swarm.mesh.dim + 1
 378
 379        if nnn > data_size[0]:
 380            nnn = data_size[0]
 381
 382        with self.swarm.access():
 383            if self.swarm.recycle_rate > 1:
 384                not_remeshed = self.swarm._remeshed.data[:, 0] != 0
 385                D = self.data[not_remeshed].copy()
 386
 387                kdt = uw.kdtree.KDTree(
 388                    self.swarm.particle_coordinates.data[not_remeshed, :]
 389                )
 390            else:
 391                D = self.data.copy()
 392                kdt = uw.kdtree.KDTree(self.swarm.particle_coordinates.data[:, :])
 393
 394            kdt.build_index()
 395
 396            values = kdt.rbf_interpolator_local(new_coords, D, nnn, verbose)
 397
 398            del kdt
 399
 400        return values
 401
 402    @property
 403    def data(self):
 404        if self._data is None:
 405            raise RuntimeError(
 406                "Data must be accessed via the swarm `access()` context manager."
 407            )
 408        return self._data
 409
 410    @property

 412        return self._meshVar.sym
 413
 414    @property
 415    def sym_1d(self):
 416        return self._meshVar.sym_1d

 418    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
 419    def save(
 420        self,
 421        filename: int,
 422        compression: Optional[bool] = False,
 423        compressionType: Optional[str] = "gzip",
 424        force_sequential=False,
 425    ):
 426        """
 427
 428        Save the swarm variable to a h5 file.
 429
 430        Parameters
 431        ----------
 432        filename :
 433            The filename of the swarm variable to save to disk.
 434        compression :
 435            Add compression to the h5 files (saves space but increases write times with increasing no. of processors)
 436        compressionType :
 437            Type of compression to use, 'gzip' and 'lzf' supported. 'gzip' is default. Compression also needs to be set to 'True'.
 438
 439        force_sequential : activate the serial version of hdf5
 440
 441        """
 442        if h5py.h5.get_config().mpi == False and comm.size > 1 and comm.rank == 0:
 443            warnings.warn(
 444                "Collective IO not possible as h5py not available in parallel mode. Switching to sequential. This will be slow for models running on multiple processors",
 445                stacklevel=2,
 446            )
 447        if compression == True and comm.rank == 0:
 448            warnings.warn("Compression may slow down write times", stacklevel=2)
 449        if filename.endswith(".h5") == False:
 450            raise RuntimeError("The filename must end with .h5")
 451
 452        if h5py.h5.get_config().mpi == True and not force_sequential:
 453            with h5py.File(
 454                f"{filename[:-3]}.h5", "w", driver="mpio", comm=MPI.COMM_WORLD
 455            ) as h5f:
 456                with self.swarm.access(self):
 457                    if compression == True:
 458                        h5f.create_dataset(
 459                            "data", data=self.data[:], compression=compressionType
 460                        )
 461                    else:
 462                        h5f.create_dataset("data", data=self.data[:])
 463        else:
 464            with self.swarm.access(self):
 465                if comm.rank == 0:
 466                    with h5py.File(f"{filename[:-3]}.h5", "w") as h5f:
 467                        if compression == True:
 468                            h5f.create_dataset(
 469                                "data",
 470                                data=self.data[:],
 471                                chunks=True,
 472                                maxshape=(None, self.data.shape[1]),
 473                                compression=compressionType,
 474                            )
 475                        else:
 476                            h5f.create_dataset(
 477                                "data",
 478                                data=self.data[:],
 479                                chunks=True,
 480                                maxshape=(None, self.data.shape[1]),
 481                            )
 482                comm.barrier()
 483                for proc in range(1, comm.size):
 484                    if comm.rank == proc:
 485                        with h5py.File(f"{filename[:-3]}.h5", "a") as h5f:
 486                            h5f["data"].resize(
 487                                (h5f["data"].shape[0] + self.data.shape[0]), axis=0
 488                            )
 489                            h5f["data"][-self.data.shape[0] :] = self.data[:]
 490                    comm.barrier()
 491                comm.barrier()
 492
 493        return
 494
 495    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
 496    def write_proxy(self, filename: str):
 497        # if not proxied, nothing to do. return.
 498        if not self._meshVar:
 499            if uw.mpi.rank == 0:
 500                print("No proxy mesh variable that can be saved", flush=True)
 501            return
 502
 503        self._meshVar.write(filename)
 504
 505        return
 506
 507    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
 508    def read_timestep(
 509        self,
 510        data_filename: str,
 511        swarmID: str,
 512        data_name: str,
 513        index: int,
 514        outputPath="",
 515    ):
 516        # mesh.write_timestep( "test", meshUpdates=False, meshVars=[X], outputPath="", index=0)
 517        # swarm.write_timestep("test", "swarm", swarmVars=[var], outputPath="", index=0)
 518
 519        output_base_name = os.path.join(outputPath, data_filename)
 520        swarmFilename = output_base_name + f".{swarmID}.{index:05}.h5"
 521        filename = output_base_name + f".{swarmID}.{data_name}.{index:05}.h5"
 522
 523        ### open up file with coords on all procs and open up data on all procs. May be problematic for large problems.
 524        with h5py.File(f"{filename}", "r") as h5f_data, h5py.File(
 525            f"{swarmFilename}", "r"
 526        ) as h5f_swarm:
 527            with self.swarm.access(self):
 528                var_dtype = self.data.dtype
 529                file_dtype = h5f_data["data"][:].dtype
 530                file_length = h5f_data["data"][:].shape[0]
 531
 532                if var_dtype != file_dtype:
 533                    if comm.rank == 0:
 534                        warnings.warn(
 535                            f"{os.path.basename(filename)} dtype ({file_dtype}) does not match {self.name} swarm variable dtype ({var_dtype}) which may result in a loss of data.",
 536                            stacklevel=2,
 537                        )
 538
 539                # First work out which are local points and ignore the rest
 540                # This might help speed up the load by dropping lots of particles
 541
 542                all_coords = h5f_swarm["coordinates"][()]
 543                all_data = h5f_data["data"][()]
 544
 545                cell = self.swarm.mesh.get_closest_local_cells(all_coords)
 546                local = np.where(cell >= 0)[0]
 547                # not_not_local = np.where(cell == -1)[0]
 548
 549                local_coords = all_coords[local]
 550                local_data = all_data[local]
 551
 552                kdt = uw.kdtree.KDTree(local_coords)
 553
 554                self.data[:] = kdt.rbf_interpolator_local(
 555                    self.swarm.data, local_data, nnn=1
 556                )
 557
 558        return
 559
 560
 561class IndexSwarmVariable(SwarmVariable):
 562    """
 563    The IndexSwarmVariable is a class for managing material point
 564    behaviour. The material index variable is rendered into a
 565    collection of masks each representing the extent of one material
 566    """
 567
 568    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
 569    def __init__(
 570        self,
 571        name,
 572        swarm,
 573        indices=1,
 574        proxy_degree=1,
 575        proxy_continuous=True,
 576    ):
 577        self.indices = indices
 578
 579        # These are the things we require of the generic swarm variable type
 580        super().__init__(
 581            name,
 582            swarm,
 583            size=1,
 584            vtype=None,
 585            dtype=int,
 586            _proxy=False,
 587        )
 588        """
 589        vtype = (None,)
 590        dtype = (float,)
 591        proxy_degree = (1,)
 592        proxy_continuous = (True,)
 593        _register = (True,)
 594        _proxy = (True,)
 595        _nn_proxy = (False,)
 596        varsymbol = (None,)
 597        rebuild_on_cycle = (True,)
 598        """
 599        # The indices variable defines how many "level set" maps we create as components in the proxy variable
 600
 601        import sympy
 602
 603        self._MaskArray = sympy.Matrix.zeros(1, self.indices)
 604        self._meshLevelSetVars = [None] * self.indices
 605
 606        for i in range(indices):
 607            self._meshLevelSetVars[i] = uw.discretisation.MeshVariable(
 608                name + R"^{[" + str(i) + R"]}",
 609                self.swarm.mesh,
 610                num_components=1,
 611                degree=proxy_degree,
 612                continuous=proxy_continuous,
 613            )
 614            self._MaskArray[0, i] = self._meshLevelSetVars[i].sym[0, 0]
 615
 616        return
 617
 618    # This is the sympy vector interface - it's meaningless if these are not spatial arrays
 619    @property
 620    def sym(self):
 621        return self._MaskArray
 622
 623    @property
 624    def sym_1d(self):
 625        return self._MaskArray
 626
 627    # We could also add a __getitem__ call to access each mask
 628
 629    def __getitem__(self, index):
 630        return self.sym[index]
 631
 632    def createMask(self, funcsList):
 633        """
 634        This creates a masked sympy function of swarm variables required for Underworld's solvers
 635        """
 636
 637        if not isinstance(funcsList, (tuple, list)):
 638            raise RuntimeError("Error input for createMask() - wrong type of input")
 639
 640        if len(funcsList) != self.indices:
 641            raise RuntimeError("Error input for createMask() - wrong length of input")
 642
 643        symo = sympy.simplify(0)
 644        for i in range(self.indices):
 645            symo += funcsList[i] * self._MaskArray[i]
 646
 647        return symo
 648

 666    def visMask(self):
 667        return self.createMask(list(range(self.indices)))
 668
 669    def view(self):
 670        """
 671        Show information on IndexSwarmVariable
 672        """
 673        if uw.mpi.rank == 0:
 674            print(f"IndexSwarmVariable {self}")
 675            print(f"Numer of indices {self.indices}")
 676
 677    def _update(self):
 678        """
 679        This method updates the proxy mesh (vector) variable for the index variable on the current swarm locations
 680
 681        Here is how it works:
 682
 683            1) for each particle, create a distance-weighted average on the node data
 684            2) for each index in the set, we create a mask mesh variable by mapping 1.0 wherever the
 685               index matches and 0.0 where it does not.
 686
 687        NOTE: If no material is identified with a given nodal value, the default is to material zero
 688
 689        ## ToDo: This should be revisited to match the updated master copy of _update
 690
 691        """
 692
 693        kd = uw.kdtree.KDTree(self._meshLevelSetVars[0].coords)
 694        kd.build_index()
 695
 696        for ii in range(self.indices):
 697            meshVar = self._meshLevelSetVars[ii]
 698
 699            # 1 - Average particles to nodes with distance weighted average
 700            with self.swarm.mesh.access(meshVar), self.swarm.access():
 701                n, d, b = kd.find_closest_point(self.swarm.data)
 702
 703                node_values = np.zeros((meshVar.data.shape[0],))
 704                w = np.zeros((meshVar.data.shape[0],))
 705
 706                for i in range(self.data.shape[0]):
 707                    if b[i]:
 708                        node_values[n[i]] += np.isclose(self.data[i], ii) / (
 709                            1.0e-16 + d[i]
 710                        )
 711                        w[n[i]] += 1.0 / (1.0e-16 + d[i])
 712
 713                node_values[np.where(w > 0.0)[0]] /= w[np.where(w > 0.0)[0]]
 714
 715            # 2 - set NN vals on mesh var where w == 0.0
 716
 717            with self.swarm.mesh.access(meshVar), self.swarm.access():
 718                meshVar.data[...] = node_values[...].reshape(-1, 1)
 719
 720                # Need to document this assumption, if there is no material found,
 721                # assume the default material (0). An alternative would be to impose
 722                # a near-neighbour hunt for a valid material and set that one.
 723
 724                if ii == 0:
 725                    meshVar.data[np.where(w == 0.0)] = 1.0
 726                else:
 727                    meshVar.data[np.where(w == 0.0)] = 0.0
 728
 729        return
 730

 733class Swarm(Stateful, uw_object):
 734    instances = 0

 736    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
 737    def __init__(self, mesh, recycle_rate=0):
 738        Swarm.instances += 1
 739
 740        self.celldm = mesh.dm.clone()
 741
 742        self._mesh = mesh
 743        self.dim = mesh.dim
 744        self.cdim = mesh.cdim
 745        self.dm = PETSc.DMSwarm().create()
 746        self.dm.setDimension(self.dim)
 747        self.dm.setType(SwarmType.DMSWARM_PIC.value)
 748        self.dm.setCellDM(self.celldm)
 749        self._data = None
 750
 751        # Is the swarm a streak-swarm ?
 752        self.recycle_rate = recycle_rate
 753        self.cycle = 0
 754
 755        # dictionary for variables
 756
 757        # import weakref (not helpful as garbage collection does not remove the fields from the DM)
 758        # self._vars = weakref.WeakValueDictionary()
 759        self._vars = {}
 760
 761        # add variable to handle particle coords - predefined by DMSwarm, expose to UW
 762        self._coord_var = SwarmVariable(
 763            "DMSwarmPIC_coor",
 764            self,
 765            self.cdim,
 766            dtype=float,
 767            _register=False,
 768            _proxy=False,
 769            rebuild_on_cycle=False,
 770        )
 771
 772        # add variable to handle particle cell id - predefined by DMSwarm, expose to UW
 773        self._cellid_var = SwarmVariable(
 774            "DMSwarm_cellid",
 775            self,
 776            1,
 777            dtype=int,
 778            _register=False,
 779            _proxy=False,
 780            rebuild_on_cycle=False,
 781        )
 782
 783        # add variable to hold swarm coordinates during position updates
 784        self._X0 = uw.swarm.SwarmVariable(
 785            "DMSwarm_X0",
 786            self,
 787            self.cdim,
 788            dtype=float,
 789            _register=True,
 790            _proxy=False,
 791            rebuild_on_cycle=False,
 792        )
 793
 794        # This is for swarm streak management:
 795        # add variable to hold swarm origins
 796
 797        if self.recycle_rate > 1:
 798            # self._Xorig = uw.swarm.SwarmVariable(
 799            #     "DMSwarm_Xorig",
 800            #     self,
 801            #     self.cdim,
 802            #     dtype=float,
 803            #     _register=True,
 804            #     _proxy=False,
 805            #     rebuild_on_cycle=False,
 806            # )
 807
 808            self._remeshed = uw.swarm.SwarmVariable(
 809                "DMSwarm_remeshed",
 810                self,
 811                1,
 812                dtype=int,
 813                _register=True,
 814                _proxy=False,
 815                rebuild_on_cycle=False,
 816            )
 817
 818        self._X0_uninitialised = True
 819        # self._Xorig_uninitialised = True
 820        self._index = None
 821        self._nnmapdict = {}
 822
 823        super().__init__()

 866    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
 867    def populate_petsc(
 868        self,
 869        fill_param: Optional[int] = 3,
 870        layout: Optional[SwarmPICLayout] = None,
 871    ):
 872        """
 873        Populate the swarm with particles throughout the domain.
 874
 875        When using SwarmPICLayout.REGULAR,     `fill_param` defines the number of points in each spatial direction.
 876        When using SwarmPICLayout.GAUSS,       `fill_param` defines the number of quadrature points in each spatial direction.
 877        When using SwarmPICLayout.SUBDIVISION, `fill_param` defines the number times the reference cell is sub-divided.
 878
 879        Parameters
 880        ----------
 881        fill_param:
 882            Parameter determining the particle count per cell for the given layout.
 883        layout:
 884            Type of layout to use. Defaults to `SwarmPICLayout.REGULAR` for mesh objects with simplex
 885            type cells, and `SwarmPICLayout.GAUSS` otherwise.
 886
 887        """
 888
 889        self.fill_param = fill_param
 890
 891        """
 892        Currently (2021.11.15) supported by PETSc release 3.16.x
 893
 894        When using a DMPLEX the following case are supported:
 895              (i) DMSWARMPIC_LAYOUT_REGULAR: 2D (triangle),
 896             (ii) DMSWARMPIC_LAYOUT_GAUSS: 2D and 3D provided the cell is a tri/tet or a quad/hex,
 897            (iii) DMSWARMPIC_LAYOUT_SUBDIVISION: 2D and 3D for quad/hex and 2D tri.
 898
 899        So this means, simplex mesh in 3D only supports GAUSS - This is based
 900        on the tensor product locations so it is not even in the cells.
 901        """
 902
 903        if layout == None:
 904            if self.mesh.isSimplex == True and self.dim == 2 and fill_param > 1:
 905                layout = SwarmPICLayout.REGULAR
 906            else:
 907                layout = SwarmPICLayout.GAUSS
 908
 909        if not isinstance(layout, SwarmPICLayout):
 910            raise ValueError("'layout' must be an instance of 'SwarmPICLayout'")
 911
 912        self.layout = layout
 913        self.dm.finalizeFieldRegister()
 914
 915        ## Commenting this out for now.
 916        ## Code seems to operate fine without it, and the
 917        ## existing values are wrong. It should be something like
 918        ## `(elend-elstart)*fill_param^dim` for quads, and around
 919        ## half that for simplices, depending on layout.
 920        # elstart,elend = self.mesh.dm.getHeightStratum(0)
 921        # self.dm.setLocalSizes((elend-elstart) * fill_param, 0)
 922
 923        self.dm.insertPointUsingCellDM(self.layout.value, fill_param)
 924        return  # self # LM: Is there any reason to return self ?
 925
 926    #
 927
 928    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
 929    def populate(
 930        self,
 931        fill_param: Optional[int] = 1,
 932    ):
 933        """
 934        Populate the swarm with particles throughout the domain.
 935
 936        Parameters
 937        ----------
 938        fill_param:
 939            Parameter determining the particle count per cell (per dimension)
 940            for the given layout, using the mesh degree.
 941
 942        cell_search:
 943            Use k-d tree to locate nearest cells (fails if this swarm is used to build a k-d tree)
 944
 945        """
 946
 947        self.fill_param = fill_param
 948
 949        newp_coords0 = self.mesh._get_coords_for_basis(fill_param, continuous=False)
 950        newp_cells0 = self.mesh.get_closest_local_cells(newp_coords0)
 951
 952        valid = newp_cells0 != -1
 953        newp_coords = newp_coords0[valid]
 954        newp_cells = newp_cells0[valid]
 955
 956        self.dm.finalizeFieldRegister()
 957        self.dm.addNPoints(newp_coords.shape[0] + 1)
 958
 959        cellid = self.dm.getField("DMSwarm_cellid")
 960        coords = self.dm.getField("DMSwarmPIC_coor").reshape((-1, self.dim))
 961
 962        coords[...] = newp_coords[...]
 963        cellid[:] = newp_cells[:]
 964
 965        self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarmPIC_coor")
 966        self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_cellid")
 967
 968        ## Now make a series of copies to allow the swarm cycling to
 969        ## work correctly (if required)
 970
 971        # cellid = self.dm.getField("DMSwarm_cellid")
 972        # lost = np.where(cellid == -1)
 973        # print(f"{uw.mpi.rank} - lost particles: {lost[0].shape} out of {cellid.shape}", flush=True)
 974        # self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_cellid")
 975
 976        if self.recycle_rate > 1:
 977            with self.access():
 978                # This is a mesh-local quantity, so let's just
 979                # store it on the mesh in an ad_hoc fashion for now
 980
 981                self.mesh.particle_X_orig = self.particle_coordinates.data.copy()
 982                self.mesh.particle_CellID_orig = self._cellid_var.data.copy()
 983
 984            with self.access():
 985                swarm_orig_size = self.particle_coordinates.data.shape[0]
 986                all_local_coords = np.vstack(
 987                    (self.particle_coordinates.data,) * (self.recycle_rate)
 988                )
 989                all_local_cells = np.vstack(
 990                    (self._cellid_var.data,) * (self.recycle_rate)
 991                )
 992
 993                swarm_new_size = all_local_coords.data.shape[0]
 994
 995            self.dm.addNPoints(swarm_new_size - swarm_orig_size)
 996
 997            cellid = self.dm.getField("DMSwarm_cellid")
 998            coords = self.dm.getField("DMSwarmPIC_coor").reshape((-1, self.dim))
 999
1000            coords[...] = (
1001                all_local_coords[...]
1002                + (0.33 / (1 + fill_param))
1003                * (np.random.random(size=all_local_coords.shape) - 0.5)
1004                * 0.00001
1005                * self.mesh._search_lengths[all_local_cells]  # typical cell size
1006            )
1007            cellid[:] = all_local_cells[:, 0]
1008
1009            self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarmPIC_coor")
1010            self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1011
1012            ## Now set the cycle values
1013
1014            with self.access(self._remeshed):
1015                for i in range(0, self.recycle_rate):
1016                    offset = swarm_orig_size * i
1017                    self._remeshed.data[offset::, 0] = i
1018
1019        # Validate (eliminate if required)
1020
1021        # cellid = self.dm.getField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1022        # lost = np.where(cellid == -1)
1023        # print(f"{uw.mpi.rank} - lost particles: {lost[0].shape} out of {cellid.shape}", flush=True)
1024        # self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1025
1026        return
1027
1028    ## This is actually an initial population routine.
1029    ## We can't use this to add particles / manage variables (LM)
1030    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
1031    def add_particles_with_coordinates(self, coordinatesArray):
1032        """
1033        This method adds particles to the swarm using particle coordinates provided
1034        using a numpy array.
1035        Note that particles with coordinates NOT local to the current processor will
1036        be reject/ignored. Either include an array with all coordinates to all processors
1037        or an array with the local coordinates.
1038        Parameters
1039        ----------
1040        coordinatesArray : numpy.ndarray
1041            The numpy array containing the coordinate of the new particles. Array is
1042            expected to take shape n*dim, where n is the number of new particles, and
1043            dim is the dimensionality of the swarm's supporting mesh.
1044        """
1045
1046        if not isinstance(coordinatesArray, np.ndarray):
1047            raise TypeError("'coordinateArray' must be provided as a numpy array")
1048        if not len(coordinatesArray.shape) == 2:
1049            raise ValueError("The 'coordinateArray' is expected to be two dimensional.")
1050        if not coordinatesArray.shape[1] == self.mesh.dim:
1051            #### petsc appears to ignore columns that are greater than the mesh dim, but still worth including
1052            raise ValueError(
1053                """The 'coordinateArray' must have shape n*dim, where 'n' is the
1054                              number of particles to add, and 'dim' is the dimensionality of
1055                              the supporting mesh ({}).""".format(
1056                    self.mesh.dim
1057                )
1058            )
1059
1060        cells = self.mesh.get_closest_local_cells(coordinatesArray)
1061
1062        valid_coordinates = coordinatesArray[cells != -1]
1063        valid_cells = cells[cells != -1]
1064
1065        npoints = len(valid_coordinates)
1066        swarm_size = self.dm.getLocalSize()
1067
1068        # -1 means no particles have been added yet
1069        if swarm_size == -1:
1070            swarm_size = 0
1071            npoints = npoints + 1
1072
1073        self.dm.finalizeFieldRegister()
1074        self.dm.addNPoints(npoints=npoints)
1075
1076        cellid = self.dm.getField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1077        coords = self.dm.getField("DMSwarmPIC_coor").reshape((-1, self.dim))
1078
1079        coords[swarm_size::, :] = valid_coordinates[:, :]
1080        cellid[swarm_size::] = valid_cells[:]
1081
1082        self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarmPIC_coor")
1083        self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1084
1085        # Here we update the swarm cycle values as required
1086
1087        if self.recycle_rate > 1:
1088            with self.access(self._remeshed):
1089                # self._Xorig.data[...] = coordinatesArray
1090                self._remeshed.data[...] = 0
1091
1092        self.dm.migrate(remove_sent_points=True)
1093
1094        return
1095
1096    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
1097    def save(
1098        self,
1099        filename: int,
1100        compression: Optional[bool] = False,
1101        compressionType: Optional[str] = "gzip",
1102        force_sequential=False,
1103    ):
1104        """
1105
1106        Save the swarm coordinates to a h5 file.
1107
1108        Parameters
1109        ----------
1110        filename :
1111            The filename of the swarm checkpoint file to save to disk.
1112        compression :
1113            Add compression to the h5 files (saves space but increases write times with increasing no. of processors)
1114        compressionType :
1115            Type of compression to use, 'gzip' and 'lzf' supported. 'gzip' is default. Compression also needs to be set to 'True'.
1116
1117
1118
1119        """
1120        if h5py.h5.get_config().mpi == False and comm.size > 1 and comm.rank == 0:
1121            warnings.warn(
1122                "Collective IO not possible as h5py not available in parallel mode. Switching to sequential. This will be slow for models running on multiple processors",
1123                stacklevel=2,
1124            )
1125        if filename.endswith(".h5") == False:
1126            raise RuntimeError("The filename must end with .h5")
1127        if compression == True and comm.rank == 0:
1128            warnings.warn("Compression may slow down write times", stacklevel=2)
1129
1130        if h5py.h5.get_config().mpi == True and not force_sequential:
1131            # It seems to be a bad idea to mix mpi barriers with the access
1132            # context manager so the copy-free version of this seems to hang
1133            # when there are many active cores. This is probably why the parallel
1134            # h5py write hangs
1135
1136            with self.access():
1137                data_copy = self.data[:].copy()
1138
1139            with h5py.File(
1140                f"{filename[:-3]}.h5", "w", driver="mpio", comm=MPI.COMM_WORLD
1141            ) as h5f:
1142                if compression == True:
1143                    h5f.create_dataset(
1144                        "coordinates",
1145                        data=data_copy[:],
1146                        compression=compressionType,
1147                    )
1148                else:
1149                    h5f.create_dataset("coordinates", data=data_copy[:])
1150
1151            del data_copy
1152
1153        else:
1154            # It seems to be a bad idea to mix mpi barriers with the access
1155            # context manager so the copy-free version of this seems to hang
1156            # when there are many active cores
1157
1158            with self.access():
1159                data_copy = self.data[:].copy()
1160
1161            if comm.rank == 0:
1162                with h5py.File(f"{filename[:-3]}.h5", "w") as h5f:
1163                    if compression == True:
1164                        h5f.create_dataset(
1165                            "coordinates",
1166                            data=data_copy,
1167                            chunks=True,
1168                            maxshape=(None, data_copy.shape[1]),
1169                            compression=compressionType,
1170                        )
1171                    else:
1172                        h5f.create_dataset(
1173                            "coordinates",
1174                            data=data_copy,
1175                            chunks=True,
1176                            maxshape=(None, data_copy.shape[1]),
1177                        )
1178
1179            comm.barrier()
1180            for i in range(1, comm.size):
1181                if comm.rank == i:
1182                    with h5py.File(f"{filename[:-3]}.h5", "a") as h5f:
1183                        h5f["coordinates"].resize(
1184                            (h5f["coordinates"].shape[0] + data_copy.shape[0]),
1185                            axis=0,
1186                        )
1187                        # passive swarm, zero local particles is not unusual
1188                        if data_copy.shape[0] > 0:
1189                            h5f["coordinates"][-data_copy.shape[0] :] = data_copy[:]
1190                comm.barrier()
1191            comm.barrier()
1192
1193            del data_copy
1194
1195        return
1196
1197    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
1198    def read_timestep(
1199        self,
1200        base_filename: str,
1201        swarm_id: str,
1202        index: int,
1203        outputPath: Optional[str] = "",
1204    ):
1205        output_base_name = os.path.join(outputPath, base_filename)
1206        swarm_file = output_base_name + f".{swarm_id}.{index:05}.h5"
1207
1208        ### open up file with coords on all procs
1209        with h5py.File(f"{swarm_file}", "r") as h5f:
1210            coordinates = h5f["coordinates"][:]
1211
1212        #### utilises the UW function for adding a swarm by an array
1213        self.add_particles_with_coordinates(coordinates)
1214
1215        return

1235    @timing.routine_timer_decorator

1237        self,
1238        swarmName: str,
1239        index: int,
1240        outputPath: Optional[str] = "",
1241    ):
1242        """
1243

1245

1247        ----------

1249            Name of the swarm to save.
1250        index :

1259    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
1260    def write_timestep(
1261        self,
1262        filename: str,
1263        swarmname: str,
1264        index: int,
1265        swarmVars: Optional[list] = None,
1266        outputPath: Optional[str] = "",
1267        time: Optional[int] = None,
1268        compression: Optional[bool] = False,
1269        compressionType: Optional[str] = "gzip",
1270        force_sequential: Optional[bool] = False,
1271    ):
1272        """
1273
1274        Save data to h5 and a corresponding xdmf for visualisation using h5py.
1275
1276        Parameters
1277        ----------
1278        swarmName :
1279            Name of the swarm to save.
1280        swarmVars :
1281            List of swarm objects to save.
1282        index :
1283            An index which might correspond to the timestep or output number (for example).
1284        outputPath :
1285            Path to save the data. If left empty it will save the data in the current working directory.
1286        time :
1287            Attach the time to the generated xdmf.
1288        compression :
1289            Whether to compress the h5 files [bool].
1290        compressionType :
1291            The type of compression to use. 'gzip' and 'lzf' are the supported types, with 'gzip' as the default.
1292        """
1293
1294        # This will eliminate the issue of whether or not to put path separators in the
1295        # outputPath. Also does the right thing if outputPath is ""
1296
1297        import os
1298
1299        output_base_name = os.path.join(outputPath, filename) + "." + swarmname
1300
1301        # could also try to coerce this to be a list and raise if it fails (tuple, singleton ... )
1302        # also ... why the typechecking if this can still happen
1303
1304        if swarmVars is not None and not isinstance(swarmVars, list):
1305            raise RuntimeError("`swarmVars` does not appear to be a list.")
1306
1307        else:
1308            ### save the swarm particle location
1309            self.save(
1310                filename=f"{output_base_name}.{index:05d}.h5",
1311                compression=compression,
1312                compressionType=compressionType,
1313                force_sequential=force_sequential,
1314            )
1315
1316        #### Generate a h5 file for each field
1317        if swarmVars != None:
1318            for field in swarmVars:
1319                field.save(
1320                    filename=f"{output_base_name}.{field.name}.{index:05d}.h5",
1321                    compression=compression,
1322                    compressionType=compressionType,
1323                    force_sequential=force_sequential,
1324                )
1325
1326        if uw.mpi.rank == 0:
1327            ### only need to combine the h5 files to a single xdmf on one proc
1328            with open(f"{output_base_name}.{index:05d}.xdmf", "w") as xdmf:
1329                # Write the XDMF header
1330                xdmf.write('<?xml version="1.0" ?>\n')
1331                xdmf.write(
1332                    '<Xdmf xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" Version="2.0">\n'
1333                )
1334                xdmf.write("<Domain>\n")
1335                xdmf.write(
1336                    f'<Grid Name="{output_base_name}.{index:05d}" GridType="Uniform">\n'
1337                )
1338
1339                if time != None:
1340                    xdmf.write(f'	<Time Value="{time}" />\n')
1341
1342                # Write the grid element for the HDF5 dataset
1343                with h5py.File(f"{output_base_name}.{index:05}.h5", "r") as h5f:
1344                    xdmf.write(
1345                        f'	<Topology Type="POLYVERTEX" NodesPerElement="{h5f["coordinates"].shape[0]}"> </Topology>\n'
1346                    )
1347                    if h5f["coordinates"].shape[1] == 2:
1348                        xdmf.write('		<Geometry Type="XY">\n')
1349                    elif h5f["coordinates"].shape[1] == 3:
1350                        xdmf.write('		<Geometry Type="XYZ">\n')
1351                    xdmf.write(
1352                        f'			<DataItem Format="HDF" NumberType="Float" Precision="8" Dimensions="{h5f["coordinates"].shape[0]} {h5f["coordinates"].shape[1]}">{os.path.basename(h5f.filename)}:/coordinates</DataItem>\n'
1353                    )
1354                    xdmf.write("		</Geometry>\n")
1355
1356                # Write the attribute element for the field
1357                if swarmVars != None:
1358                    for field in swarmVars:
1359                        with h5py.File(
1360                            f"{output_base_name}.{field.name}.{index:05d}.h5", "r"
1361                        ) as h5f:
1362                            if h5f["data"].dtype == np.int32:
1363                                xdmf.write(
1364                                    f'	<Attribute Type="Scalar" Center="Node" Name="{field.name}">\n'
1365                                )
1366                                xdmf.write(
1367                                    f'			<DataItem Format="HDF" NumberType="Int" Precision="4" Dimensions="{h5f["data"].shape[0]} {h5f["data"].shape[1]}">{os.path.basename(h5f.filename)}:/data</DataItem>\n'
1368                                )
1369                            elif h5f["data"].shape[1] == 1:
1370                                xdmf.write(
1371                                    f'	<Attribute Type="Scalar" Center="Node" Name="{field.name}">\n'
1372                                )
1373                                xdmf.write(
1374                                    f'			<DataItem Format="HDF" NumberType="Float" Precision="8" Dimensions="{h5f["data"].shape[0]} {h5f["data"].shape[1]}">{os.path.basename(h5f.filename)}:/data</DataItem>\n'
1375                                )
1376                            elif h5f["data"].shape[1] == 2 or h5f["data"].shape[1] == 3:
1377                                xdmf.write(
1378                                    f'	<Attribute Type="Vector" Center="Node" Name="{field.name}">\n'
1379                                )
1380                                xdmf.write(
1381                                    f'			<DataItem Format="HDF" NumberType="Float" Precision="8" Dimensions="{h5f["data"].shape[0]} {h5f["data"].shape[1]}">{os.path.basename(h5f.filename)}:/data</DataItem>\n'
1382                                )
1383                            else:
1384                                xdmf.write(
1385                                    f'	<Attribute Type="Tensor" Center="Node" Name="{field.name}">\n'
1386                                )
1387                                xdmf.write(
1388                                    f'			<DataItem Format="HDF" NumberType="Float" Precision="8" Dimensions="{h5f["data"].shape[0]} {h5f["data"].shape[1]}">{os.path.basename(h5f.filename)}:/data</DataItem>\n'
1389                                )
1390
1391                            xdmf.write("	</Attribute>\n")
1392                else:
1393                    pass
1394
1395                # Write the XDMF footer
1396                xdmf.write("</Grid>\n")
1397                xdmf.write("</Domain>\n")
1398                xdmf.write("</Xdmf>\n")
1399
1400    @property
1401    def vars(self):
1402        return self._vars
1403
1404    def access(self, *writeable_vars: SwarmVariable):
1405        """
1406        This context manager makes the underlying swarm variables data available to
1407        the user. The data should be accessed via the variables `data` handle.
1408
1409        As default, all data is read-only. To enable writeable data, the user should
1410        specify which variable they wish to modify.
1411
1412        At the conclusion of the users context managed block, numerous further operations
1413        will be automatically executed. This includes swarm parallel migration routines
1414        where the swarm's `particle_coordinates` variable has been modified. The swarm
1415        variable proxy mesh variables will also be updated for modifed swarm variables.
1416
1417        Parameters
1418        ----------
1419        writeable_vars
1420            The variables for which data write access is required.
1421
1422        Example
1423        -------
1424
1425        >>> import underworld3 as uw
1426        >>> someMesh = uw.discretisation.FeMesh_Cartesian()
1427        >>> with someMesh.deform_mesh():
1428        ...     someMesh.data[0] = [0.1,0.1]
1429        >>> someMesh.data[0]
1430        array([ 0.1,  0.1])
1431        """
1432        import time
1433
1434        uw.timing._incrementDepth()
1435        stime = time.time()
1436
1437        deaccess_list = []
1438        for var in self._vars.values():
1439            # if already accessed within higher level context manager, continue.
1440            if var._is_accessed == True:
1441                continue
1442            # set flag so variable status can be known elsewhere
1443            var._is_accessed = True
1444            # add to de-access list to rewind this later
1445            deaccess_list.append(var)
1446            # grab numpy object, setting read only if necessary
1447            var._data = self.dm.getField(var.clean_name).reshape(
1448                (-1, var.num_components)
1449            )
1450            assert var._data is not None
1451            if var not in writeable_vars:
1452                var._old_data_flag = var._data.flags.writeable
1453                var._data.flags.writeable = False
1454            else:
1455                # increment variable state
1456                var._increment()
1457
1458            # make view for each var component
1459            if var._proxy:
1460                for i in range(0, var.shape[0]):
1461                    for j in range(0, var.shape[1]):
1462                        var._data_container[i, j] = var._data_container[i, j]._replace(
1463                            data=var.data[:, var._data_layout(i, j)],
1464                        )
1465
1466        # if particles moving, update swarm state
1467        if self.particle_coordinates in writeable_vars:
1468            self._increment()
1469
1470        # Create a class which specifies the required context
1471        # manager hooks (`__enter__`, `__exit__`).
1472        class exit_manager:
1473            def __init__(self, swarm):
1474                self.em_swarm = swarm
1475
1476            def __enter__(self):
1477                pass
1478
1479            def __exit__(self, *args):
1480                for var in self.em_swarm.vars.values():
1481                    # only de-access variables we have set access for.
1482                    if var not in deaccess_list:
1483                        continue
1484                    # set this back, although possibly not required.
1485                    if var not in writeable_vars:
1486                        var._data.flags.writeable = var._old_data_flag
1487                    var._data = None
1488                    self.em_swarm.dm.restoreField(var.clean_name)
1489                    var._is_accessed = False
1490                # do particle migration if coords changes
1491
1492                if self.em_swarm.particle_coordinates in writeable_vars:
1493                    # let's use the mesh index to update the particles owning cells.
1494                    # note that the `petsc4py` interface is more convenient here as the
1495                    # `SwarmVariable.data` interface is controlled by the context manager
1496                    # that we are currently within, and it is therefore too easy to
1497                    # get things wrong that way.
1498
1499                    cellid = self.em_swarm.dm.getField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1500                    coords = self.em_swarm.dm.getField("DMSwarmPIC_coor").reshape(
1501                        (-1, self.em_swarm.dim)
1502                    )
1503
1504                    cellid[:] = self.em_swarm.mesh.get_closest_cells(coords).reshape(-1)
1505
1506                    self.em_swarm.dm.restoreField("DMSwarmPIC_coor")
1507                    self.em_swarm.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1508                    # now migrate.
1509
1510                    self.em_swarm.dm.migrate(remove_sent_points=True)
1511
1512                    # void these things too
1513                    self.em_swarm._index = None
1514                    self.em_swarm._nnmapdict = {}
1515
1516                # do var updates
1517                for var in self.em_swarm.vars.values():
1518                    # if swarm migrated, update all.
1519                    # if var updated, update var.
1520                    if (self.em_swarm.particle_coordinates in writeable_vars) or (
1521                        var in writeable_vars
1522                    ):
1523                        var._update()
1524
1525                    if var._proxy:
1526                        for i in range(0, var.shape[0]):
1527                            for j in range(0, var.shape[1]):
1528                                # var._data_ij[i, j] = None
1529                                var._data_container[i, j] = var._data_container[
1530                                    i, j
1531                                ]._replace(
1532                                    data=f"SwarmVariable[...].data is only available within mesh.access() context",
1533                                )
1534
1535                uw.timing._decrementDepth()
1536                uw.timing.log_result(time.time() - stime, "Swarm.access", 1)
1537
1538        return exit_manager(self)
1539
1540    ## Better to have one master copy - this one is cut'n'pasted from
1541    ## the MeshVariable class
1542
1543    def _data_layout(self, i, j=None):
1544        # mapping
1545
1546        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.SCALAR:
1547            return 0
1548        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.VECTOR:
1549            if j is None:
1550                return i
1551            elif i == 0:
1552                return j
1553            else:
1554                raise IndexError(
1555                    f"Vectors have shape {self.mesh.dim} or {(1, self.mesh.dim)} "
1556                )
1557        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.TENSOR:
1558            if self.mesh.dim == 2:
1559                return ((0, 1), (2, 3))[i][j]
1560            else:
1561                return ((0, 1, 2), (3, 4, 5), (6, 7, 8))[i][j]
1562
1563        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.SYM_TENSOR:
1564            if self.mesh.dim == 2:
1565                return ((0, 2), (2, 1))[i][j]
1566            else:
1567                return ((0, 3, 4), (3, 1, 5), (4, 5, 2))[i][j]
1568
1569        if self.vtype == uw.VarType.MATRIX:
1570            return i + j * self.shape[0]
1571
1572    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
1573    def _get_map(self, var):
1574        # generate tree if not avaiable
1575        if not self._index:
1576            with self.access():
1577                self._index = uw.kdtree.KDTree(self.data)
1578
1579        # get or generate map
1580        meshvar_coords = var._meshVar.coords
1581        # we can't use numpy arrays directly as keys in python dicts, so
1582        # we'll use `xxhash` to generate a hash of array.
1583        # this shouldn't be an issue performance wise but we should test to be
1584        # sufficiently confident of this.
1585        import xxhash
1586
1587        h = xxhash.xxh64()
1588        h.update(meshvar_coords)
1589        digest = h.intdigest()
1590        if digest not in self._nnmapdict:
1591            self._nnmapdict[digest] = self._index.find_closest_point(meshvar_coords)[0]
1592        return self._nnmapdict[digest]
1593
1594    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
1595    def advection(
1596        self,
1597        V_fn,
1598        delta_t,
1599        order=2,
1600        corrector=False,
1601        restore_points_to_domain_func=None,
1602        evalf=False,
1603    ):
1604
1605        dt_limit = self.estimate_dt(V_fn)
1606
1607        if dt_limit is not None:
1608            substeps = int(max(1, abs(delta_t) // dt_limit))
1609        else:
1610            substeps = 1
1611
1612        # X0 holds the particle location at the start of advection
1613        # This is needed because the particles may be migrated off-proc
1614        # during timestepping.
1615
1616        X0 = self._X0
1617
1618        V_fn_matrix = self.mesh.vector.to_matrix(V_fn)
1619
1620        # Use current velocity to estimate where the particles would have
1621        # landed in an implicit step. WE CANT DO THIS WITH SUB-STEPPING unless
1622        # We have a lot more information about the previous launch point / timestep
1623        # Also: how does this interact with the particle restoration function ?
1624
1625        # if corrector == True and not self._X0_uninitialised:
1626        #     with self.access(self.particle_coordinates):
1627        #         v_at_Vpts = np.zeros_like(self.data)
1628
1629        #         if evalf:
1630        #             for d in range(self.dim):
1631        #                 v_at_Vpts[:, d] = uw.function.evalf(
1632        #                     V_fn_matrix[d], self.data
1633        #                 ).reshape(-1)
1634        #         else:
1635        #             for d in range(self.dim):
1636        #                 v_at_Vpts[:, d] = uw.function.evaluate(
1637        #                     V_fn_matrix[d], self.data
1638        #                 ).reshape(-1)
1639
1640        #         corrected_position = X0.data.copy() + delta_t * v_at_Vpts
1641        #         if restore_points_to_domain_func is not None:
1642        #             corrected_position = restore_points_to_domain_func(
1643        #                 corrected_position
1644        #             )
1645
1646        #         updated_current_coords = 0.5 * (corrected_position + self.data.copy())
1647
1648        #         # validate_coords to ensure they live within the domain (or there will be trouble)
1649
1650        #         if restore_points_to_domain_func is not None:
1651        #             updated_current_coords = restore_points_to_domain_func(
1652        #                 updated_current_coords
1653        #             )
1654
1655        #         self.data[...] = updated_current_coords[...]
1656
1657        #         del updated_current_coords
1658        #         del v_at_Vpts
1659
1660        with self.access(X0):
1661            X0.data[...] = self.data[...]
1662            self._X0_uninitialised = False
1663
1664        # Wrap this whole thing in sub-stepping loop
1665        for step in range(0, substeps):
1666
1667            # Mid point algorithm (2nd order)
1668
1669            if order == 2:
1670                with self.access(self.particle_coordinates):
1671                    v_at_Vpts = np.zeros_like(self.data)
1672
1673                    if evalf:
1674                        for d in range(self.dim):
1675                            v_at_Vpts[:, d] = uw.function.evalf(
1676                                V_fn_matrix[d], self.data
1677                            ).reshape(-1)
1678                    else:
1679                        for d in range(self.dim):
1680                            v_at_Vpts[:, d] = uw.function.evaluate(
1681                                V_fn_matrix[d], self.data
1682                            ).reshape(-1)
1683
1684                    mid_pt_coords = (
1685                        self.data[...].copy() + 0.5 * delta_t * v_at_Vpts / substeps
1686                    )
1687
1688                    # validate_coords to ensure they live within the domain (or there will be trouble)
1689
1690                    if restore_points_to_domain_func is not None:
1691                        mid_pt_coords = restore_points_to_domain_func(mid_pt_coords)
1692
1693                    self.data[...] = mid_pt_coords[...]
1694
1695                    del mid_pt_coords
1696
1697                    ## Let the swarm be updated, and then move the rest of the way
1698
1699                with self.access(self.particle_coordinates):
1700                    v_at_Vpts = np.zeros_like(self.data)
1701
1702                    if evalf:
1703                        for d in range(self.dim):
1704                            v_at_Vpts[:, d] = uw.function.evalf(
1705                                V_fn_matrix[d], self.data
1706                            ).reshape(-1)
1707                    else:
1708                        for d in range(self.dim):
1709                            v_at_Vpts[:, d] = uw.function.evaluate(
1710                                V_fn_matrix[d], self.data
1711                            ).reshape(-1)
1712
1713                    # if (uw.mpi.rank == 0):
1714                    #     print("Re-launch from X0", flush=True)
1715
1716                    new_coords = X0.data[...].copy() + delta_t * v_at_Vpts / substeps
1717
1718                    # validate_coords to ensure they live within the domain (or there will be trouble)
1719                    if restore_points_to_domain_func is not None:
1720                        new_coords = restore_points_to_domain_func(new_coords)
1721
1722                    self.data[...] = new_coords[...]
1723
1724                    del new_coords
1725                    del v_at_Vpts
1726
1727            # forward Euler (1st order)
1728            else:
1729                with self.access(self.particle_coordinates):
1730                    v_at_Vpts = np.zeros_like(self.data)
1731
1732                    if evalf:
1733                        for d in range(self.dim):
1734                            v_at_Vpts[:, d] = uw.function.evalf(
1735                                V_fn_matrix[d], self.data
1736                            ).reshape(-1)
1737                    else:
1738                        for d in range(self.dim):
1739                            v_at_Vpts[:, d] = uw.function.evaluate(
1740                                V_fn_matrix[d], self.data
1741                            ).reshape(-1)
1742
1743                    new_coords = self.data + delta_t * v_at_Vpts / substeps
1744
1745                    # validate_coords to ensure they live within the domain (or there will be trouble)
1746
1747                    if restore_points_to_domain_func is not None:
1748                        new_coords = restore_points_to_domain_func(new_coords)
1749
1750                    self.data[...] = new_coords[...].copy()
1751
1752        ## End of substepping loop
1753
1754        ## Cycling of the swarm is a cheap and cheerful version of population control for particles. It turns the
1755        ## swarm into a streak-swarm where particles are Lagrangian for a number of steps and then reset to their
1756        ## original location.
1757
1758        if self.recycle_rate > 1:
1759            # Restore particles which have cycle == cycle rate (use >= just in case)
1760
1761            # Remove remesh points and recreate a new set at the mesh-local
1762            # locations that we already have stored.
1763
1764            with self.access(self.particle_coordinates, self._remeshed):
1765                remeshed = self._remeshed.data[:, 0] == 0
1766                # This is one way to do it ... we can do this better though
1767                self.data[remeshed, 0] = 1.0e100
1768
1769            swarm_size = self.dm.getLocalSize()
1770
1771            num_remeshed_points = self.mesh.particle_X_orig.shape[0]
1772
1773            self.dm.addNPoints(num_remeshed_points)
1774
1775            cellid = self.dm.getField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1776            coords = self.dm.getField("DMSwarmPIC_coor").reshape((-1, self.dim))
1777            rmsh = self.dm.getField("DMSwarm_remeshed")
1778
1779            # print(f"cellid -> {cellid.shape}")
1780            # print(f"particle coords -> {coords.shape}")
1781            # print(f"remeshed points  -> {num_remeshed_points}")
1782
1783            perturbation = 0.00001 * (
1784                (0.33 / (1 + self.fill_param))
1785                * (np.random.random(size=(num_remeshed_points, self.dim)) - 0.5)
1786                * self.mesh._radii[cellid[swarm_size::]].reshape(-1, 1)
1787            )
1788
1789            # print(f"{perturbation}")
1790
1791            coords[swarm_size::] = self.mesh.particle_X_orig[:, :] + perturbation
1792            cellid[swarm_size::] = self.mesh.particle_CellID_orig[:, 0]
1793            rmsh[swarm_size::] = 0
1794
1795            self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1796            self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarmPIC_coor")
1797            self.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_remeshed")
1798
1799            # when we let this go, the particles may be re-distributed to
1800            # other processors, and we will need to rebuild the remeshed
1801            # array before trying to compute / assign values to variables
1802
1803            for swarmVar in self.vars.values():
1804                if swarmVar._rebuild_on_cycle:
1805                    with self.access(swarmVar):
1806                        if swarmVar.dtype is int:
1807                            nnn = 1
1808                        else:
1809                            nnn = self.mesh.dim + 1  # 3 for triangles, 4 for tets ...
1810
1811                        interpolated_values = (
1812                            swarmVar.rbf_interpolate(self.mesh.particle_X_orig, nnn=nnn)
1813                            #     swarmVar._meshVar.fn, self.mesh.particle_X_orig
1814                            # )
1815                        ).astype(swarmVar.dtype)
1816
1817                        swarmVar.data[swarm_size::] = interpolated_values
1818
1819            self.dm.migrate(remove_sent_points=True)
1820
1821            with self.access(self._remeshed):
1822                self._remeshed.data[...] = np.mod(
1823                    self._remeshed.data[...] - 1, self.recycle_rate
1824                )
1825
1826            self.cycle += 1
1827
1828        return
1829
1830    @timing.routine_timer_decorator
1831    def estimate_dt(self, V_fn):
1832        """
1833        Calculates an appropriate advective timestep for the given
1834        mesh and velocity configuration.
1835        """
1836        # we'll want to do this on an element by element basis
1837        # for more general mesh
1838
1839        # first let's extract a max global velocity magnitude
1840        import math
1841
1842        with self.access():
1843            vel = uw.function.evalf(V_fn, self.particle_coordinates.data)
1844            magvel_squared = vel[:, 0] ** 2 + vel[:, 1] ** 2
1845            if self.mesh.dim == 3:
1846                magvel_squared += vel[:, 2] ** 2
1847
1848            max_magvel = math.sqrt(magvel_squared.max())
1849
1850        from mpi4py import MPI
1851
1852        comm = MPI.COMM_WORLD
1853        max_magvel_glob = comm.allreduce(max_magvel, op=MPI.MAX)
1854
1855        min_dx = self.mesh.get_min_radius()
1856
1857        # The assumption should be that we cross one or two elements (4 radii), not more,
1858        # in a single step (order 2, means one element per half-step or something
1859        # that we can broadly interpret that way)
1860
1861        if max_magvel_glob != 0.0:
1862            return 4.0 * min_dx / max_magvel_glob
1863        else:
1864            return None
1865
1866
1867class NodalPointSwarm(Swarm):
1868    r"""Swarm with particles located at the coordinate points of a meshVariable
1869
1870    The swarmVariable `X0` is defined so that the particles can "snap back" to their original locations
1871    after they have been moved.
1872
1873    The purpose of this Swarm is to manage sample points for advection schemes based on upstream sampling
1874    (method of characteristics etc)"""
1875
1876    def __init__(
1877        self,
1878        trackedVariable: uw.discretisation.MeshVariable,
1879    ):
1880        self.trackedVariable = trackedVariable
1881        self.swarmVariable = None
1882        mesh = trackedVariable.mesh
1883
1884        # Set up a standard swarm
1885        super().__init__(mesh)
1886
1887        nswarm = self
1888
1889        meshVar_name = trackedVariable.clean_name
1890        meshVar_symbol = trackedVariable.symbol
1891
1892        ks = str(self.instance_number)
1893        name = f"{meshVar_name}_star"
1894        symbol = rf"{{ {meshVar_symbol} }}^{{ <*> }}"
1895
1896        self.swarmVariable = uw.swarm.SwarmVariable(
1897            name,
1898            nswarm,
1899            vtype=trackedVariable.vtype,
1900            proxy_degree=trackedVariable.degree,
1901            proxy_continuous=trackedVariable.continuous,
1902            varsymbol=symbol,
1903        )
1904
1905        name = f"ns_X0_{ks}"
1906        symbol = r"X0^{*^{{[" + ks + "]}}}"
1907        nX0 = uw.swarm.SwarmVariable(name, nswarm, nswarm.dim, _proxy=False)
1908
1909        nswarm.dm.finalizeFieldRegister()
1910        nswarm.dm.addNPoints(
1911            trackedVariable.coords.shape[0] + 1
1912        )  # why + 1 ? That's the number of spots actually allocated
1913
1914        cellid = nswarm.dm.getField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1915        coords = nswarm.dm.getField("DMSwarmPIC_coor").reshape((-1, nswarm.dim))
1916        coords[...] = trackedVariable.coords[...]
1917        cellid[:] = self.mesh.get_closest_cells(coords)
1918
1919        # Move slightly within the chosen cell to avoid edge effects
1920        centroid_coords = self.mesh._centroids[cellid]
1921        shift = 1.0e-3
1922        coords[...] = (1.0 - shift) * coords[...] + shift * centroid_coords[...]
1923
1924        nswarm.dm.restoreField("DMSwarmPIC_coor")
1925        nswarm.dm.restoreField("DMSwarm_cellid")
1926        nswarm.dm.migrate(remove_sent_points=True)
1927
1928        with nswarm.access(nX0):
1929            nX0.data[...] = coords
1930
1931        self._nswarm = nswarm
1932        self._X0 = nX0
1933
1934        return
